attributes.action: stop UK chatrooms and online role-playing games charging for services
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Chatrooms across the UK and USA charge large amounts of money to use the service to the full. Some just exclude small services, others use large ones. Take Club Penguin and Gaia Online, for example. Both charge money. Club Penguin charges at least $5.95 per month which is worth around £3, although it claims to be "a kid-friendly virtual world where children can play games, have fun and interact with each other". Gaia Online takes money in return for using the "Gaia Shop" which is a basic avatar item shop. These are just two of hundreds of chatrooms, many of which are in the UK.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
